sec.p: We obtained silica-dried leaf material from 38 populations of Emmenopterys henryi throughout its range ( Table S1, Fig. 1A; see Supplementary Method S1 for more details of the study species). In each population, representative samples of 10–20 plants were taken, resulting in a total of 433 individuals. Total genomic DNA was extracted from the dried leaf tissue using a DNeasy plant tissue kit (Qiagen). All samples were sequenced at three intergenic spacer (IGS) regions of chloroplast DNA (cpDNA), while a subset of individuals ( n = 212) was also sequenced at the entire internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region of nuclear ribosomal DNA (nrDNA). Of these 433 individuals, 394 (representing 37 populations; population S23 with 1 individual was excluded) were surveyed for AFLPs ( Table S1; Fig. 1A). Pinckneya bracteata (Bartram) Raf., collected from the JC Raulston Arboretum (Raleigh, NC, USA), was selected as an outgroup for the phylogenetic analyses based on a previous molecular phylogenetic study of Rubiaceae 33. Voucher specimens of this species and all sampled populations of E. henryi are stored at the Herbarium of Zhejiang University (HZU; Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China).
